questions.question: What is Git?
options: A version control system
A programming language
An operating system
A database management system

questions.question: What is the purpose of Git?
options: To manage project documentation
To track changes in source code
To compile and run code
To manage database records

questions.question: What is a Git repository?
options: A server for hosting Git projects
A folder where Git tracks changes and history
A graphical user interface (GUI) for Git
A programming interface for interacting with Git

questions.question: What is a Git branch?
options: A specific version of Git software
A parallel line of development in a repository
A command-line tool for interacting with Git
A user interface for managing Git repositories

questions.question: What is the command to create a new Git branch?
options: git init
git add
git branch
git commit

questions.question: What is the purpose of Git merging?
options: To discard changes in a branch
To combine changes from different branches
To rename a branch
To revert to a previous commit

questions.question: What is a Git commit?
options: A command to save changes to the local repository
A compressed archive of source code files
A branch in a Git repository
A remote server for hosting Git repositories

questions.question: What is the command to commit changes in Git?
options: git add
git push
git commit
git pull

questions.question: What is a Git remote?
options: A local copy of a Git repository
A command for removing Git branches
A reference to a remote repository
A tool for resolving Git conflicts

questions.question: What is the purpose of Git cloning?
options: To create a new Git repository
To rename a Git repository
To download a copy of a remote repository
To delete a Git repository

questions.question: What is a Git pull?
options: A command to push changes to a remote repository
A command to fetch and merge changes from a remote repository
A command to discard changes in a local repository
A command to create a new branch

questions.question: What is the purpose of Git rebase?
options: To switch between Git branches
To create a new Git repository
To combine multiple commits into one
To undo the last Git commit

questions.question: What is a Git stash?
options: A command to remove untracked files
A command to save changes temporarily
A command to list all Git branches
A command to discard changes in a branch

questions.question: What is the purpose of Git tagging?
options: To mark a specific commit in Git history
To exclude files from version control
To rename a Git branch
To create a new remote repository

questions.question: What is the command to create a new Git tag?
options: git commit
git tag
git merge
git push

questions.question: What is a Git conflict?
options: A situation where Git cannot find a remote repository
A situation where Git branches have different commits
A situation where Git branches have the same commit
A situation where Git cannot access the local repository

questions.question: What is the purpose of Git branching strategies?
options: To track changes in source code
To organize and manage parallel development
To revert to a previous commit
To share Git repositories with others

questions.question: What is a Git remote repository?
options: A local copy of a Git repository
A command for removing Git branches
A reference to a remote server hosting a Git repository
A tool for resolving Git conflicts

questions.question: What is the purpose of Git fetching?
options: To create a new Git repository
To rename a Git repository
To download changes from a remote repository
To delete a Git repository

questions.question: What is a Git rebase conflict?
options: A conflict that occurs during Git merging
A conflict that occurs during Git rebasing
A conflict that occurs during Git cloning
A conflict that occurs during Git pulling

questions.question: What is the purpose of Git cherry-picking?
options: To discard changes in a branch
To combine changes from different branches
To apply a specific commit to a branch
To revert to a previous commit

questions.question: What is a Git hook?
options: A command for removing Git branches
A reference to a remote repository
A tool for resolving Git conflicts
A script triggered by Git events

questions.question: What is the purpose of Git bisect?
options: To search for specific commits in Git history
To delete Git branches
To switch between Git branches
To rename a Git repository

questions.question: What is a Git submodule?
options: A command to push changes to a remote repository
A command to fetch and merge changes from a remote repository
A command to include another Git repository as a subdirectory
A command to create a new branch

questions.question: What is the purpose of Git reflog?
options: To track changes in source code
To organize and manage parallel development
To view the history of Git references
To share Git repositories with others

questions.question: What is a Git rebase?
options: A command to remove untracked files
A command to save changes temporarily
A command to switch between Git branches
A command to integrate changes from one branch to another

questions.question: What is the purpose of Git ignore?
options: To mark a specific commit in Git history
To exclude files from version control
To rename a Git branch
To create a new remote repository

questions.question: What is the command to create a new Git ignore file?
options: git commit
git tag
git merge
git ignore

questions.question: What is a Git pull request?
options: A command to push changes to a remote repository
A command to fetch and merge changes from a remote repository
A command to discard changes in a local repository
A request to merge changes from a branch on a remote repository

questions.question: What is the purpose of Git blame?
options: To search for specific commits in Git history
To view the commit history of a file
To switch between Git branches
To create a new branch
